metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18495 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
WebExtension content scripts can be loaded into about: pages in somecircumstances, in violation of the permissions granted to extensions. Thiscould allow an extension to interfere with the loading and usage of thesepages and use capabilities that were intended to be restricted fromextensions. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 64.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
